conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions team—I'm Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_D and believe I would be a strong fit for your program and community. I’d like to formally apply and would be excited to accept an offer if admitted. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but I have relatively low priority there (4th) and several other students rank it highly, so an early [APPLY] is likely to be rejected if higher-priority applicants apply. School_D is my 4th choice but I am 2nd in School_D’s priority list, giving me a strong chance to secure a match quickly. Locking in School_D now avoids the risk of ending up at my last choice later.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and your strong interest in School_D. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_D, and we believe you would be a great addition to our community.

We look forward to welcoming you.

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_D has quota 1 and true priority order: D > E > C > B > A. In this round, both Student_E and Student_C applied. Student_E is ranked higher than Student_C on our priority list. Accepting Student_E now secures a high-priority match; the only better outcome would be Student_D, but they did not contact us and rank School_D last, making it very unlikely they will apply. Therefore, accepting Student_E is optimal versus holding out and risking losing both E and C.

conversation.message: [APPLY] Hello School_D, I’m Student_C. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m very motivated to join your program. If accepted, I will commit to enrolling and contributing actively to the school community. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_D, so I should apply immediately. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), and while Student_D and Student_E outrank me, they each have strong alternatives they may pursue first. Applying now maximizes my chance to secure my #1 before the seat is taken.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_D is your first choice. We truly appreciate your strong interest and commitment.

At this time, we have already filled our available seat, so we’re unable to offer you admission in this round.

We wish you the very best in the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: Student_C is 3rd on School_D’s true priority list, and they are applying with strong commitment. However, School_D’s remaining quota is 0 and we already accepted Student_E this round (a higher-priority student than Student_C). Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY].

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m very eager to join your community and would accept an offer immediately if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

Given Student_D ranks School_B third and Student_A ranks School_B fourth, they may still apply after being rejected/filled elsewhere, so holding the seat is valuable. Therefore, reject Student_B now to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates.
